Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.professor_prompt: Let's discuss the skills most needed by people who want to start and run their own business. Some experts propose that future businesspeople should focus on improving their sales techniques —after all, if you cannot sell your product, you will soon be out of business. Others believe that these future businesspeople would benefit most from learning management skills, such as how to lead teams and motivate employees. Which view do you agree with? Why?
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.student_1_response: I think that management skills are most important. Sales tasks are something that a businessperson can delegate to a team of salespeople once the business gets going, so it is really important that the future businessperson develops skills to manage teams of people. Without that, it is not very likely that the business will grow.
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.student_2_response: Learning how to sell your product is the most essential task. I've read about people who had ideas about exciting new products to build a business around. They borrowed capital and started their business, but they could not explain to the public what made the products exciting. Since they could not sell enough products, their business failed.
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.folder_name: Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techniques Or Management Skills？
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.original_image_file: Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techniques Or Management Skills？.png

Children's Caring for Pets.professor_prompt: Keeping and caring for pet animals (for example, cats, dogs, and birds) is a human behavior we see in most cultures. Often it is children who ask to keep and care for a pet of their own, or who share the responsibility of caring for a pet with other family members. In your opinion, do children gain important benefits from caring for a pet animal? Why or why not?
Children's Caring for Pets.student_1_response: I can think of one clear benefit. When you read interviews with famous scientists, especially biologists, you learn that their interest in science was often awakened because they had a pet animal or animals as children. Playing with the animals and observing them led those people to develop an interest in natural science.
Children's Caring for Pets.student_2_response: I think there often isn't any real benefit. What typically happens, unfortunately, is that parents get a pet animal for their child because the child likes animals in books or films. But when they have to take care of a real animal, those children lose interest, and it's the parents who end up taking care of it.
Children's Caring for Pets.original_image_file: Children Gain Benefits from Caring for A Pet Animal？.png

The Best Way to Make New Friends.professor_prompt: In our class this week, we are going to talk about the importance of friendship to each individual. As we all know, humans are social creatures. Making new friends can be difficult in certain circumstances, but there are many successful ways to make friends, of course. What do you think is the best way to make new friends and why do you think so?
The Best Way to Make New Friends.student_1_response: Volunteering is a good way to make new friends. Recently our city's Beautification Committee asked for volunteers to plant flowers around the downtown square, to make it more appealing for residents and visitors. I joined a dozen others in that activity. While we worked, we had the opportunity to talk and get to know each other.
The Best Way to Make New Friends.student_2_response: I have made a few good friends by taking a class at the local library. It was a class in stamp collecting, and I met some very interesting people. The key is to stay in touch after the class is over, do additional activities together, and make an effort to build a friendship. We just had lunch together today.
The Best Way to Make New Friends.folder_name: The Best Way to Make New Friends
The Best Way to Make New Friends.original_image_file: The Best Way to Make New Friends.png

Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.professor_prompt: This week, we've been discussing ways to protect the environment. One way is to require companies to pay penalties, such as higher taxes or large fines, when they pollute and damage the environment. We're going to explore this topic in depth tomorrow, but first I'd like to get your thoughts: Do you think imposing these taxes and fines would be a good way to stop companies from harming the environment? Why or why not?
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.student_1_response: I don't think it will be effective. Where I live, the local government imposes fines on polluting companies, but it doesn't stop them. I know of one business that created a lot of water pollution. Instead of changing their ways, they just paid a fine. No one was really punished, and the pollution is still a problem.
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.student_2_response: I think it's an excellent idea. As long as there is no penalty for polluting the environment, these companies will not bother searching for alternatives to practices that contribute to air, water, or land pollution. And it should be a financial penalty because every company worries about money.
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.folder_name: Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Companies from Harming the Environment
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.original_image_file: Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Companies from Harming the Environment.png

Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be discussing the future of education. Let's focus now on the following viewpoint: it is no longer useful to spend many years pursuing a traditional, specialized university degree in a single field, such as communications or economics. Instead, it makes more sense for most people to complete several shorter certification programs and earn certificates in, for example, project management, computer programming, graphic design, and so on. Do you agree or disagree with this viewpoint? Why?
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.student_1_response: I agree that completing short certification programs makes a lot of sense these days because people are more likely to change careers now than they were in the past. Certification programs allow people to quickly learn a variety of professional skills that are in demand at the moment. And acquiring such skills leads to more job opportunities.
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.student_2_response: I see the advantages of earning certificates, but I don't think that they can completely replace university degrees. Certification programs provide only superficial knowledge, while university degrees offer a well-developed and organized approach to studying. By pursuing university degrees, students gain foundational knowledge and a broader understanding of their field of study and develop many skills as well.
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.folder_name: Several Shorter Certification Or A University Degree？
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.original_image_file: Several Shorter Certification Or A University Degree？.png

The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.professor_prompt: To continue our discussion on adopting an environmentally friendly lifestyle, let's explore the role that individuals can play in keeping the Earth as clean as possible. Recycling is the most common action taken to help keep the environment clean, but studies show that recycling alone is not enough. Other than recycling, what is one action that a person could take that would have the greatest impact on protecting the environment? Why?
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.student_1_response: It might be better to pay more attention when we are shopping and to avoid purchasing items that aren't environmentally friendly, such as single-use plastic items. Doing so would save time and energy because we will not have to recycle anything, and it might even leave us with more time to help the environment in other ways.
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.student_2_response: People should try to prevent pollution just like Kelly suggests, but it might be better to first address the pollution that already exists in our environment. If people plant trees and shrubs in their yards or in the local parks, these trees and shrubs might absorb pollutants that we breathe in and help to clean the air in our cities.
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.folder_name: The Greatest Impact on Protecting Environment for One Person
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.original_image_file: The Greatest Impact on Protecting Environment for One Person.png

The Most Important Subject.professor_prompt: In your opinion, what qualities or characteristics should universities look for when admitting students? Explain your reasoning using specific details and examples.
The Most Important Subject.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that students who are at the top of their class and did not have to work hard for their achievements would be more successful in the long run.
The Most Important Subject.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that students who work hard and overcome challenges to achieve their goals would be more successful in the long run.

What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.professor_prompt: This week we will discuss issues faced by secondary school administrators. I'm referring to schools for teenage students. One such issue is students who change schools. Students change schools for many different reasons, the most common being a family move. On the discussion board, I want you to exchange ideas about what schools can do to make the transition to a new school easier for teenagers.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.student_1_response: I think schools should assign new students a fellow student who can help them adjust. The student buddy can do things like make sure the new student can find the cafeteria or the right classrooms. For new students, it's a lot easier to ask a fellow student a question rather than ask a teacher or the principal.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.student_2_response: I would require new students to sign up for some school club or activity that meets outside of class. That way, new students would have an easy way to meet other students in a friendly environment. It would give them a group to immediately identify with.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.folder_name: What Schools Can Do to Make Transition to A New School Easier
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.original_image_file: What Schools Can Do to Make Transition to A New School Easier.png

Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.professor_prompt: In today's discussion, we'll explore the following question: Some people believe that the government should tax fuel (like gasoline) heavily and use the revenue to subsidize electricity costs for homes and businesses. Others argue that this approach is not effective. What is your opinion on this policy?
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.student_1_response: I believe that taxing fuel and using the revenue to subsidize electricity is a reasonable policy approach. By making fuel more expensive, the government can encourage people to reduce their fuel consumption, which would help protect the environment. Additionally, subsidizing electricity costs would make it more affordable for families and businesses to use energy. This could be especially helpful for low-income households that struggle to pay their electricity bills.
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.student_2_response: While I understand the reasoning behind this policy, I think it may not be the most effective approach. Taxing fuel heavily could place a significant financial burden on people who rely on vehicles for their daily commute or work, such as delivery drivers or construction workers. Instead, the government should invest in extra training programs for workers in fossil fuel industries to help them transition to cleaner energy jobs. This would address environmental concerns while also supporting affected workers.
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.folder_name: Governments Encourage More Use of Electric Vehicles

What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.professor_prompt: In this unit, we will be learning about effective strategies for increasing student motivation. Let's begin by discussing one common concern shared by many high school teachers: some of their students, typically aged 14 to 18, seem to be bored or uninterested in learning. In your view, what strategy should teachers use to increase high school students' interest in learning? Please explain why you think this one particular strategy will be effective.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.student_1_response: I believe teachers should incorporate more group work activities into their lessons. While completing tasks in groups or teams, students will have an opportunity to share their opinions and learn from their peers. Having a sense of belonging is important to teenagers, so being part of a team will likely make them more interested in learning.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.student_2_response: In my opinion, teachers should explain how the lessons they teach in the classroom have a connection to events in the world outside high school. Students will likely become more interested in learning once they understand that the lessons can help them be better prepared for future university studies and work.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.folder_name: What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Increase High School Students' Interest in Learning

Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.topic: Online Classes vs Traditional In-Person Classes in Education
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.professor_prompt: In the next few weeks, we'll be discussing different learning options and their respective benefits and drawbacks. Let's focus now on online classes, which are becoming more and more popular. In online classes, students communicate with their professors and other students completely online. Do you think that online classes offer advantages to both students and teachers that make them preferable to traditional in-person classes? Why or why not?
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.student_1_response: I believe online classes are preferable to traditional face-to-face classes, both for students and teachers. Because online classes allow more flexibility (for example, in terms of location and time), they better accommodate students and teachers with busy schedules. The quality of online classes has considerably improved, so online classes now present excellent learning options.
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.student_2_response: Online classes don't have any advantages over traditional in-person classes. What's important is how good the teacher is. An online class won't be any good if the instructor isn't a talented teacher. But an online class can be effective if the teacher knows how to teach and how to use online resources. Teacher competence is what matters most.
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.folder_name: Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person Classes？
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.original_image_file: Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person Classes？.png

New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.topic: Educational Policy - New Courses in Public Schools
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.professor_prompt: This week we are studying how policy for public schools is created and how it may change over time. One very important topic for educational policy involves what courses should be taught in schools. Many people believe that new forms of communication and new kinds of employment require that new and different kinds of courses be taught. The question I want you to discuss is whether new, innovative subjects should be taught in public schools.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.student_1_response: I definitely think there should be new kinds of courses taught in public schools. For instance, people communicate more and more on the Internet by sharing photographs and videos with each other. I think a course in video composition—that is, how to make good and effective videos—would be really valuable to today's students. And there are many other similar topics that students might benefit from.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.student_2_response: I really don't think the high school curriculum needs to change. The main purpose of most courses in high school is to prepare students for higher education, and those basic requirements haven't changed. If students want to learn other things, like how to compose photographs or edit films, they can watch instructional videos on the Internet. They don't need a class in school to learn things like that.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.folder_name: New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taught in Public Schools
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.original_image_file: New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taught in Public Schools.JPG

Financial Support to Artists.professor_prompt: We've been discussing government budgets and the difficult decisions governments must make regarding the use of public funds. Some services are clearly essential and must be paid for by any government. But what about public funding of the arts? Do you believe that governments should provide financial support to artists—for example, painters, sculptors, musicians, or filmmakers? Why or why not?
Financial Support to Artists.student_1_response: I enjoy art as much as anyone does, but public funds come from taxes, and I don't think taxpayers' hard-earned money should be spent on impractical or inessential items and services. Artists should support themselves by selling their work to private individuals and companies. If they can't find enough buyers, then maybe they should change careers.
Financial Support to Artists.student_2_response: Personally, I think art actually is essential. Lots of public spaces in my hometown just wouldn't be the same without artwork. From statues in public parks to murals painted on the walls of government buildings, my hometown really benefits from funding the artists who created these works. The public spaces are simply more enjoyable for visitors because of the artwork.

Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.professor_prompt: In class this week, we are looking at how markets work, particularly in regard to energy costs. Petroleum, also known simply as oil, is one of the most important international commodities. When the global market price of oil goes up, fuels such as gasoline (petrol) also become more expensive. Many people think governments should step in to protect consumers from increases in fuel prices. What is your view? Do you think governments should actively keep fuel prices low for consumers?
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.student_1_response: I think it's a good government policy. Most people have to drive or use public transportation, like a bus, to get to work. When the price of gasoline goes up, it costs them more to get to work. People don't have a choice about whether to go to work or not, so they should be protected from price increases.
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.student_2_response: I think the government keeping gas prices low is a bad policy. The biggest problem we face now is global climate change. The more expensive gasoline is, the less people will drive, and thus they will contribute fewer greenhouse gases to the air. Lowering the cost of gas just makes the problem worse.
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.folder_name: Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.original_image_file: Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.png

Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.professor_prompt: In the past, it was common for people to stay at one job for a long time, possibly for their whole career. This has changed in recent years, though, and nowadays many people tend to change jobs quite often. Proponents of this job market trend point to many benefits of regularly changing careers. Today, I would like to know what you think. Do you agree that the benefits of switching jobs often outweigh the disadvantages? Why or why not?
Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.student_1_response: I believe that it can be beneficial for people to change jobs often. If you do the same job for a long time (for example, several years), you might become too comfortable with the job. This could mean the job is no longer challenging for you and it could cause you to be bored and unsatisfied at work.
Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.student_2_response: I agree with some of what Paul wrote, but we also need to consider the disadvantages of changing jobs often. Switching jobs can make you feel insecure and exhausted, especially if you are changing fields and have to learn new skills. Additionally, you have to adapt to a new environment and new colleagues, which can be overwhelming as well.

Career or Relationships Imapcting Happin.professor_prompt: Next week we'll be talking about factors that contribute to human happiness. Surveys reveal that career satisfaction and the quality of personal relationships, such as with family and friends, are frequently identified as two important factors for happiness. Which one do you think most people would say has the greater impact on their overall happiness and why?
Career or Relationships Imapcting Happin.student_1_response: I believe that one's career has a larger impact on overall happiness. It's through people's jobs that they make a contribution to society and are recognized for their contributions. Through people's jobs, they can make a contribution to something greater than themselves, which can be very fulfilling. A sense of satisfaction can come from a job well done.
Career or Relationships Imapcting Happin.student_2_response: Work is not all that matters: if you're someone who works full-time, that's still only half of your waking life. To maximize happiness, it's vital to maintain connections with people you care about and who care about you. For example there's nothing like lifting my spirits like being able to talk to a friend when I'm down.

School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.topic: School Curriculum: Foundational Knowledge vs. Creative Subjects
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.professor_prompt: What should children be learning in school? Many people believe that time in the classroom should be spent acquiring foundational knowledge in subjects like math, reading, science, and history. Others feel that it's important for a child's creativity to be nurtured, and thus the school curriculum must include classes in art and music. There's so much to learn, yet so little time in school to learn it all! What do you think should be included in the curriculum? Why?
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.student_1_response: I agree that traditional subjects like math, science, and reading are important, but so are classes in art and music. Engaging with art and music can help children be more creative and can stimulate their imaginations. That in turn facilitates critical thinking, which is essential in any curriculum, so I am in favor of including art and music in the school day.
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.student_2_response: Sure, drawing pictures and listening to music is fun, but children can do that on their own time. The school day is too short as it is, and there is so much foundational knowledge in math, reading, science, and history that children need to learn; it is better to spend classroom time on that foundational knowledge and let kids explore art and music at home.
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.folder_name: School Curriculum Must Include Classes in Art and Music
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.original_image_file: School Curriculum Must Include Classes in Art and Music.png

What Approach That Governments Can Use t.professor_prompt: Let's think about population trends in urban and rural areas (villages). Living in urban areas can be expensive; nonetheless, when they have a choice of where to live, people in some countries do not wish to live in rural areas even if the cost of living there is lower. If governments of some countries want to attract more people to live in rural areas or villages, what is the best strategy or approach that governments can use? Why?
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.student_1_response: I would live in a rural area if the government gave more financial help to farmers. Although it may cost very little to live in a rural area, it costs a lot to begin a career in agriculture. If I had financial help, I would start my own farm and be happy to live in a rural area.
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.student_2_response: In my country, urban centers are great places to live because you can access shops, restaurants, and museums. If the government of my country wanted to attract me to live in a rural area, the area would first have to attract more businesses focused on entertainment and culture than most rural areas have now.
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.folder_name: What Approach That Governments Can Use to Attract More People to Live in Rural Areas
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.original_image_file: What Approach That Governments Can Use to Attract More People to Live in Rural Areas.jpg

Participation in Team Sports Important f.topic: Role of Team Sports in Child Development
Participation in Team Sports Important f.professor_prompt: Let's discuss the role that being on a sports team plays in a child's development. Many argue that playing a team sport, such as basketball, football, or baseball, is an important experience that all children can benefit from—in different ways. Conversely, others feel that the focus on team sports for children does more harm than good. What do you think? Is participation in team sports important for a child's development? Why or why not?
Participation in Team Sports Important f.student_1_response: Of course, children should participate in team sports! Not everyone is a great student. For many children, team sports are a chance to excel and build their confidence. They can recognize the importance of working hard to accomplish a goal, and this can transfer to other aspects of their lives.
Participation in Team Sports Important f.student_2_response: I don't think participating in team sports is always a good thing. One reason is the bad behavior of parents during their children's competitions. Too many parents get overly invested and want to win more than their children do. To that end, they will argue with sports officials and referees and set a bad example for their children.
Participation in Team Sports Important f.folder_name: Participation in Team Sports Important for A Child's Development？
Participation in Team Sports Important f.original_image_file: Participation in Team Sports Important for A Child's Development？.png

Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.professor_prompt: Today there are many educational computer programs and applications designed to teach people what they want to learn. Many teachers use these developing technologies to help them teach their students, although it is still widely assumed that human teachers have a vital role to play in formal education. Other people believe that human teachers could one day be replaced by extremely sophisticated educational technologies. Which viewpoint do you agree
Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.student_1_response: Computer technologies could actually motivate students even more than human teachers do. Many young people spend hours playing video games, which are really just sophisticated computer programs that challenge a human player with a variety of tasks. If educational applications challenged students in appealing ways, as video games do, they could hold students' interest longer than human teachers do.
Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.student_2_response: I think it's doubtful that educational technologies could ever satisfactorily replace human teachers in the classroom. An important part of education is motivation to learn. Educational technologies may work well for people who want to learn, but they probably can't motivate students who are bored by a particular subject. An effective human teacher can spark student interest.

How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.professor_prompt: Starting this week, we are going to discuss the effect that pollution has on our environment. Specifically, we will focus on the pollution of waterways, which has caused significant health problems around the world. Large amounts of plastics, industrial waste, and trash pollute the oceans and rivers. I want you to consider the following question: How much can individuals help solve the water pollution problem compared with large institutions such as corporations and governments? Please explain your position.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.student_1_response: Individual efforts will likely have little effect. It is better to focus on large corporations that do the most damage to our waterways. Think of the oil companies that have spills and factory owners that dump chemicals into the waterways. Individuals pollute the water too, but companies have much more impact. Business leaders need to set examples for the community.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.student_2_response: I think individual people are the first step in solving the pollution problem. For example, when one person stops using harmful chemicals or helps clean up a local waterway, it can inspire others. They can use social media to spread the word and share examples of positive behavior. This can quickly become a grassroots movement for change.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.folder_name: How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pollution V.S. Large Institution
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.original_image_file: How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pollution V.S. Large Institution.png

Flexible Work Schedules.professor_prompt: Next week, we'll examine some challenges that managers face. One challenge is determining how much independence employees should have. Consider this: many managers give employees the freedom to set their own working hours. For example, an employee might choose to start the workday earlier than is typical. But other managers do not allow flexible schedules, arguing that they create problems. In industries where flexible work schedules are possible, do you think they are a good idea? Why or why not?
Flexible Work Schedules.student_1_response: Flexible schedules are a good idea. For example, they could eliminate the problem of employees being late to work. If people begin work when it best suits their schedule, not only will this benefit the workers, but there will also be no need for supervisors to check every day if all the workers are on time. Everyone will benefit.
Flexible Work Schedules.student_2_response: Claire makes an interesting point, but I'm not convinced. What if the employee's clients or colleagues need access to the employee? If an employee is unavailable at a time of day when most people are doing business, that might be inconvenient and even frustrating for others. That could harm work relationships, which would not be good for the company.

The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.professor_prompt: In the next two weeks, we are going to be studying how biological discoveries have affected our lives. Research in biology provides us with a better understanding of how our bodies work. As an introduction to this topic, I would like for you to discuss among yourselves this question: What is the most important thing a person can do to maintain good health? Please explain why you think so.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.student_1_response: I feel very strongly that a good diet is the most important factor in maintaining good health. Eating good, healthy foods, especially green vegetables, gives your body the materials it needs to stay strong. Good nutrition is the key to good health.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.student_2_response: Most people don't visit the doctor for regular checkups. Sure, if they feel sick, they go, but that's not enough. During a yearly exam, a physician can help a patient address health issues before they become a larger problem. So I think preventive doctor visits are key to good health.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.folder_name: The Most Important Thing to Maintain Good Health
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.original_image_file: The Most Important Thing to Maintain Good Health.png

Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.professor_prompt: This week we are talking about how different cities choose to either preserve or replace older, historic buildings. Some cities have strict rules about preserving older buildings and homes, especially those with historic architecture. Others tend to encourage new construction to replace structures that are aging and decaying. Should cities try to save historic buildings or replace them with more modern ones?
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.student_1_response: I think the preservation of old historic buildings involves a lot of problems, especially in densely populated cities. In modern cities, land is very valuable, and old buildings just do not provide as much living and working space as modern high-rise buildings. Also, they were not built to modern standards, so they may waste energy through inefficient heating and cooling.
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.student_2_response: It's important to preserve historic buildings. Keeping original architecture helps preserve a city's culture. Even on the practical side, most big cities get an economic benefit from tourism, and historic buildings like hotels and theaters are big attractions. Who wants to visit a city where all the buildings are glass and steel and look like buildings in every other city?
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.folder_name: Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.original_image_file: Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.png

What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.professor_prompt: Should people donate money to help people in their own country or to help people in other countries?
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.student_1_response: From my perspective, donating money locally would be a better choice. First, donating locally is less likely to cross out of the bound of one's actual financial ability. Donating locally tends to be less costly in comparison to globally because of its smaller range, meaning that money can be used more fully when distributing certain amount of money to a smaller area. In this way, donating locally can be achieved by many people such as college students who take a part-time job, or regular workers who hold strong social responsibility. However, it is always commercial leaders who possess hundreds of wealth would be capable of donating globally which may require the money several times than that of workers gain from his or her whole life. Second, donating locally would have a higher possibility of receiving feedback. Within donors community, their fame would increase because of the donation. When they need help, people would be willing to give a hand. However, donating globally seems too far from donors' lives, and those who benefit from the donation may not even know the name of the donor.
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.student_2_response: In my opinion, donating to international organizations can create a more significant impact. While local donations are convenient, global organizations have the resources and expertise to address large-scale issues like climate change, pandemics, and poverty that transcend national borders. These organizations can pool donations from around the world to fund major projects that no single country could accomplish alone. Additionally, helping people in other countries promotes cross-cultural understanding and global solidarity. While local donations are valuable for immediate community needs, supporting international causes allows us to contribute to solutions that benefit humanity as a whole.
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.folder_name: What Factors Should Be Taken into Account When Choosing Local Or International Charity Organizations

Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.topic: Consumer Behavior - Buying Domestic vs Imported Products
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.professor_prompt: Some people prefer to buy certain goods produced outside their own country for various reasons, such as better price, appearance, or quality. While imported goods can offer advantages, the consumer's home country might benefit more if consumers buy products made where they live. Do you think people should try to buy goods made in their own country? Why or why not?
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.student_1_response: Being on a budget, I must purchase products at a lower price, regardless of where they come from. I just bought a phone that works like a name-brand phone but was in my price range; I will purchase whatever product is the best price and has the features I need. So buying goods made outside my country doesn't bother me.
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.student_2_response: Products such as clothing that are made in my country are often more attractive than those made in other places, even if they are a bit more expensive. Buying attractive products made in my country is more satisfying than buying less-expensive goods from abroad. It helps manufacturers in my country, and I really enjoy the look of the clothes.
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.folder_name: Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.original_image_file: Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.png

Buying Used Or Recycled Products.topic: Environmental Impact on Consumer Behavior: Buying Used vs New Products
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.professor_prompt: This week in class, we are discussing how concern about the environment is affecting consumer behavior. One recent trend in some countries is that consumers are trying to reuse products and materials as much as possible; for example, by buying used clothing or a used car instead of a new one. In your posts, I want you to discuss either an advantage or a disadvantage of buying used or recycled products as opposed to new ones.
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.student_1_response: Besides the benefits to the environment, one advantage is that many vintage, previously owned products have more charm. For example, old furniture has a lot of character and history, and it always makes a room more interesting. People can even make furniture from reclaimed materials, like making a table from an old wooden door, which always looks unique.
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.student_2_response: Buying used products has its drawbacks. New products are backed by the company that made them. If you buy a new washing machine and it does not work properly, the company will replace or repair it. If you buy something used and it breaks, it's your responsibility to fix it, and the parts are not always available.

Car-free Central Zones.professor_prompt: In the next few weeks, we'll be talking about urban traffic management. Let's begin by discussing one popular idea—creating car-free central zones. Some cities around the world have recently designated their downtown areas as being automobile-free, which means that vehicles are not allowed to enter the city centers. Do you think that more cities should make their central zones car-free? Why or why not?
Car-free Central Zones.student_1_response: I support the idea of establishing car-free central zones because this will result in one important benefit for city residents—it will be better for their health. Instead of driving everywhere, people will be encouraged to walk or cycle more. It would be a great way to incorporate exercise into people's routines.
Car-free Central Zones.student_2_response: It sounds like a good idea, but I'm skeptical. My main concern is that many businesses located in the city centers, such as shops and restaurants, may suffer because the customers will no longer be able to reach those businesses by car. For some customers, if they can't drive, they won't go at all.

The Most Important Thing University Shou.professor_prompt: Last week, we started talking about decisions that university administrators have to make regarding spending. They often need to decide how to allocate their funds, including renovating existing facilities, offering new amenities, and so on. For example, a university could spend money to upgrade a sports stadium, build a new performing arts center, or do a variety of other things. What is the most important thing university administrators should consider when making
The Most Important Thing University Shou.student_1_response: I think the university should get input from its students about what improvement they want to see on their campus. After all, they make up the majority of people who will be attending sporting events at a renovated stadium or live musical and theater performances in a new performing arts center.
The Most Important Thing University Shou.student_2_response: The university needs to consider how much revenue a facility would generate. Building a new facility or renovating an old one would both be very costly, so administrators need to think about which option would bring in the most money in the future. Generating revenue would allow the university to make other improvements to the campus in the future.
The Most Important Thing University Shou.folder_name: The Most Important Thing University Should Consider When Making Spending
The Most Important Thing University Shou.original_image_file: The Most Important Thing University Should Consider When Making Spending.png

Difference between People from Different.professor_prompt: With so many opportunities to connect nowadays, some people believe that no matter which country we come from, we have more similarities than we have differences. However, others have observed that differences between themselves and people from other countries are growing. In your view, are differences between people from different countries increasing, or are they diminishing? Why?
Difference between People from Different.student_1_response: I think the differences among us are decreasing as our exposure to products from other countries grows. We can enjoy food from any country. We can watch movies made in faraway places. We can go to a store and buy authentic goods from around the world. These things become part of our normal life and make our differences seem smaller.
Difference between People from Different.student_2_response: I understand what Andrew is saying, but for some people, being exposed to differences makes them retreat into their own corner even more. Look at social media. We are exposed to many different people and ideas, but a lot of people talk to only those they agree with and ignore the rest. This only makes the differences between people increase.
Difference between People from Different.folder_name: Difference between People from Different Countries Increasing Or Diminishing？
Difference between People from Different.original_image_file: Difference between People from Different Countries Increasing Or Diminishing？.jpg

Excessive Consumption.professor_prompt: We've been discussing the idea that human well-being is not necessarily improved by ever-increasing production and consumption of goods and services. Some people argue that humans already consume too many goods, from clothing to electronics to food; they believe that excessive consumption has created serious problems for humanity and even the planet. Do you agree that excessive consumption--buying more than we truly need--has become a serious problem? Why or why not?
Excessive Consumption.student_1_response: I absolutely agree. We buy far more than we need, and that can't continue indefinitely. For years people have used shopping as a form of recreation. The products bought on a whim are filling up landfills, and the energy expended producing the goods has created a global warming crisis. We should start gradually reducing consumption.
Excessive Consumption.student_2_response: I disagree with the idea that over-consumption is a dramatic problem. I agree there is some over-consumption, but it happens mostly with wealthy people. I think in general almost everyone else already buys only what they need. In fact, many people around the world are not even able to obtain everything they need.

Lecturing or Project-based Learning.topic: Education - Project-based Learning vs Traditional Lectures
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.professor_prompt: This week we will be focusing on an instructional approach called project-based learning. In traditional teaching, teachers largely give lectures and ask students questions about the lecture material. But in project-based learning, students acquire and demonstrate knowledge and skills by working on a course-related project, typically with other students. Before our class tomorrow, I'd like your opinion: Do you think project-based learning is more effective at promoting learning than the traditional lecture method?
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.student_1_response: I find the traditional lecture method to be more effective because the information students need to know is given to them directly. In project-based learning, students need to find their own topics and rely on themselves to get information and they might end up missing important information about the topic.
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.student_2_response: I think the process of project-based learning is more effective at helping you develop useful skills, especially interpersonal skills that can be helpful in your career. You can even list the projects you have worked on when applying for a job, which should impress potential employers.

Job-Sharing Arrangement.professor_prompt: In recent years, some companies have introduced job-sharing arrangements, in which two employees share the responsibilities of a single full-time position. Do you think this practice is beneficial for both companies and workers?
Job-Sharing Arrangement.student_1_response: In my point of view, job-sharing arrangement is a poor idea in the workforce. First off, such working arrangement might severely hurt companies' profits since it would necessarily decrease employees' working efficiency. Dividing one job into exactly two parts with the same amount of workload is rather difficult to bear, as some more troubles would be able to create between two workers which would decrease one less efficiency.
Job-Sharing Arrangement.student_2_response: I believe that job-sharing arrangements can be very convenient for both companies and workers. For companies, they can attract more talented candidates by offering flexible working options, which can help retain experienced employees who might otherwise leave due to family commitments or other obligations. For workers, job-sharing allows for better work-life balance while still maintaining a professional career and income. This flexibility can lead to higher job satisfaction and reduced stress, ultimately benefiting the company through increased productivity and lower turnover rates.

Continual Risks as Business Strategy.professor_prompt: We've been discussing business strategies and the attitudes of businesspeople toward risk and opportunity. The scientist Albert Einstein once said that a person who never made a mistake never tried anything new. He was probably referring to physics, but I wonder how this attitude might apply to the business world. Do you think it is a good business strategy to take continual risks even though they might result in mistakes that could affect a company negatively?
Continual Risks as Business Strategy.student_1_response: I think this strategy can easily backfire on a businessperson. I've seen companies conduct endless cycles of product enhancements in an effort to capture some other market share. But in reality, they just damage their own brand by sacrificing too much of the original content that made the product popular in the first place.
Continual Risks as Business Strategy.student_2_response: I disagree with Paul. Most profitable businesses have used this strategy, or they would have never made it to the top. If you try to grow a business aggressively, some mistakes along the way are inevitable. Too much caution or too much emphasis on avoiding mistakes can really prevent growth.

Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.professor_prompt: We have recently read in our textbook that local or regional governments often need to reduce the amount of money budgeted in some areas in response to economic shortfalls. For instance, a city council may make the difficult decision to spend less on a certain public service for its residents. In your view, in what one or two areas should local or regional governments reduce spending when budget cuts are necessary? Why?
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.student_1_response: My city has a lot of parks that require a lot of upkeep. If there's a need to reduce expenses, the city could make changes to the parks that make them less expensive to maintain. For example, grass lawns, which need to be cut weekly, could be replaced with other plant species that do not need to be cut frequently.
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.student_2_response: Last time I went to City Hall to take care of some business, I saw a lot of employees standing around and doing nothing. I think the local government may be employing too many workers. It was just an impression I had, but I wonder if this is something that should be reviewed.
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.folder_name: Local or Regional Government Reducing Spending
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.original_image_file: Local or Regional Government Reducing Spending.png

Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be discussing ways in which schools can help expose their students (aged 5-18) to learning experiences beyond the classroom. Let's begin by discussing one popular idea that some schools are considering—offering outdoor classes once a month. On the day of outdoor classes, students will be transported to local parks or nature preserves, and teachers can help students explore nature and learn about the environment. Do you think this is a good idea?
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.student_1_response: Having outdoor classes once a month seems like an exciting way of providing students with interesting hands-on experiences. However, I don't think these classes would be a worthwhile use of instructional time and of school resources. These classes could put substantial pressure on schools' financial resources and on teachers, who may have to redesign their lesson plans.
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.student_2_response: Outdoor classes can increase students' motivation for learning about interconnectedness in the natural world. These classes could be great opportunities to teach students about dire environmental problems, such as pollution, and ways of addressing these problems. It will deepen their understanding beyond what books could do and would be time well spent.
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.folder_name: Students Exploring Nature and Learning about Environment
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.original_image_file: Students Exploring Nature and Learning about Environment.png

Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.topic: Mobile Phone Age Limit for Children
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.professor_prompt: This week we covered different parenting styles. One idea we discussed was how much independence and freedom we should give our children, especially young children. One related issue is whether there should be an age limit on when children can have mobile phones. In this discussion post, I would like you to discuss whether you agree or disagree with the idea of setting a minimum age for when children can have a mobile phone. Explain your opinion.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.student_1_response: I totally agree with the idea of not giving children phones before they reach a certain age, let's say ten years or so. I believe children younger than ten are not yet ready to deal with the world that comes with mobile phones, as it can put them in harm's way.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.student_2_response: Honestly, I am against the idea of restricting mobile phone access for young children. I believe mobile phones can help children communicate with their parents if they need their help for an urgent matter when they are away from their parents at school or elsewhere. Maybe companies can invent a special kind of mobile phone that is somehow kid friendly.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.folder_name: Setting A Minimum age for Children to Have Mobile Phones
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.original_image_file: Setting A Minimum age for Children to Have Mobile Phones.png

Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.professor_prompt: We have read studies that explain the negative impact of social media on both children and adults. Many believe that social media will remain widely used in the future, since it is both popular and useful in some contexts, but because of the problems it poses, it should be regulated in some way. In your opinion, should governments regulate social media platforms, or should social media companies regulate their platforms themselves? Why do you think so?
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.student_1_response: I believe social media companies should regulate themselves. There are plenty of social media platforms on the market, so the competition is tough. For example, to appeal to parents, a social media platform could publicize that they have stringent regulations for children's use of the platform, and in this way it could attract more users who care about children's safety.
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.student_2_response: Social media companies should be taking an active role in combatting the negative effects, but that is not really happening. I hear many stories of false information spreading around, sometimes causing irreparable damage to people's reputations. Therefore, the government should put stricter regulations on the companies, and they should be punished for not following the rules.
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.folder_name: Governments Or Companies Regulate Social Media Platform
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.original_image_file: Governments Or Companies Regulate Social Media Platform.png

Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.professor_prompt: Last class, we started talking about how almost anyone today can write and post news articles to a Web site or even host a news podcast. People no longer need a degree in journalism or a professional connection to a news outlet to express their views and ideas to a wide audience. Some people believe this development negatively affects the field of journalism as well as consumers of news. Do you agree with this viewpoint? Why or why not?
Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.student_1_response: I do worry that people practicing journalism without professional training can actually harm others. Journalism courses in universities really emphasize the importance of checking facts and doing thorough research. I am concerned that someone who has not been taught journalistic standards may mislead readers in potentially harmful ways.
Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.student_2_response: In the past, there was a much more limited range of views expressed in newspapers and other publications. I think we benefit today because many different points of view are expressed on social media. While journalistic standards on the Internet may not always be high, at least readers get to hear stories that might not otherwise be told.

Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.professor_prompt: This week we talked about how important taking time off from work or school is for people's well-being. Some people believe they get the most benefit when that time off is structured; that is, it involves planning in advance about what will be accomplished on that day. Others believe it is better to enjoy the day with no plan for how to spend it. In this discussion post, please indicate which of those approaches to spending time off from work or school you prefer, and why.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.student_1_response: I find it beneficial to do some advance planning for my free time. I live far away from my family, so when I am getting ready to visit them during a school holiday, I always plan my time off from school very carefully. That way I have enough time to visit with each family member.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.student_2_response: Personally, I prefer not to make any plans for my free time. I go to school, and I have a part-time job, and each week I make a schedule to be sure I can complete both my work and my studies. So when I have time off from work and school, I just want to relax with no plan.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.folder_name: Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work or School
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.original_image_file: Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work or School.png

Requiring First-year Students to Take A.topic: Requiring First-year Students to Take A Course on Good Study Habits
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be learning about different ways to help students develop good study skills. Let's begin by discussing the following situation. According to administrators at some universities, first-year students often arrive with poor study skills. These administrators believe that the best way to address the situation is to require all first-year students to take a course on good study habits. Do you agree that this requirement is a good idea? Why or why not?
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.student_1_response: I support requiring all first-year students to attend a course on good study habits. Even basic skills such as how to take good notes are very important for succeeding in university studies, and I don't think all students acquire these skills while in high school. Many students would benefit from learning or refreshing these skills in a required course.
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.student_2_response: In my view, such a course should not be a university requirement. The efforts to improve study skills should begin in high school instead. That seems more appropriate. If you don't have well-developed academic skills by the time you get to university, perhaps you're not properly prepared.
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.folder_name: Requiring First-year Students to Take A Course on Good Study Habits
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.topic: Pursuing an Advanced Degree While Working Full-time
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be talking about continuing education. Many people who have university degrees and work full-time jobs want to deepen their knowledge and skills. Some of them decide to continue their education by enrolling in advanced degree programs, such as master's or doctorate programs. Do you think that it is a good idea to pursue an advanced degree while continuing to work full-time? Why or why not?
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.student_1_response: I think it's better to stop working and become a full-time student. It's challenging to combine a full-time job and studies, and one may easily fall behind. Focus on one thing at a time and do it well rather than try to do both and do neither very well. Overextending yourself can lead to disappointment.
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.student_2_response: I think it is a good idea to study for an advanced degree while continuing to work full-time. Some of my friends took that path. One advantage, they told me, was that what they had learned in class they could use at work right away, and their coworkers were very impressed.
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.folder_name: Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working Full-time？
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.topic: Education: Teaching Fiction vs. Nonfiction Texts
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.professor_prompt: Some educators think that in our global, tech-oriented world, students need to focus on nonfiction texts, such as news stories, technical manuals, or other informational materials. They say that reading poetry, novels, and short stories is not the optimal use of the limited time that students have in the classroom. How do you view this approach to education? Should schools limit the teaching of fictional texts in favor of teaching more practical, nonfiction texts?
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.student_1_response: In my point of view, I believe that the school should also provide students with the opportunity of learning literature and analyzing fictional texts. First, it is true that students who have chosen scientific fields of study could easily find their ideal occupations in the future, but studying literature would also enable students to find a wide range of jobs. For example, literature majors could choose to become editors or writers in the publishers; they could also choose to become reporters because they are more skillful in delivering messages of ideas orally; they could also become teachers and impart knowledge to other students. Therefore, studying literature would also help students find suitable jobs in the future. Besides, learning fictional texts would enable students to develop a good reading habit, increasing their interest in terms of reading books.
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.student_2_response: From my point of view, schools should teach more practical, nonfiction texts. Firstly, practical texts are more useful in job hunting than fiction texts do, since practical texts would solely focus on providing knowledge and theories that can be applied to people's future work. Therefore, schools need to offer students practical knowledge in order to provide a chance for them to secure ideal jobs. Especially, in these days, there are lots of people craving for one job now and one person needs to be truly outstanding enough so that he or she needs to have the practical skills that can be used immediately in the workplace. Fiction may be enjoyable, but it does not prepare students for the realities of the job market.
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.professor_prompt: This week we discussed the fact that in some education systems, doing volunteer work is a requirement for graduation from high school. That is, students would not receive their high school diplomas until they provide evidence of doing volunteer work to serve their community; for example, they might distribute food to the needy and document how many hours they spent doing that. In your post, discuss whether you agree or disagree with the idea of requiring volunteer work for graduation and why you feel that way.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.student_1_response: While volunteering is important, I do not think requiring it is acceptable. An integral part of volunteering is one's willingness to sacrifice time and effort for the good of others without expecting a reward. If volunteering becomes a requirement, it loses that essential quality of not expecting a reward—because there would be a reward, namely, graduation.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.student_2_response: While I agree with parts of Claire's argument, I like the idea of making volunteering a requirement. By having students practice the act of volunteering during high school, even if it is required and not merely out of goodwill, it will become a part of their lives that they will continue doing after they graduate.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.topic: Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Children
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.professor_prompt: This semester, we are studying how children learn and what influences their cognitive development. We know that children are affected both positively and negatively by what they see and hear. Many parents allow their children to watch entertaining or educational videos on devices like smartphones or tablets. Overall, do you think watching a lot of online videos is harmful to children? Why or why not?
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.student_1_response: I think watching online videos is harmful to children. Children under two years old need to develop communication skills by interacting with other people; passively watching videos exposes them to language, but it's not the same. Also, even for older children, sitting and staring at a device means they are not moving and exercising. I agree with Andrew that very young children who are learning to communicate should not watch a lot of videos. However, for children who are past that stage, videos can be great. Lots of kids' videos are about animals and nature. Most kids will never see a whale in its natural environment, but online, they can learn all about whales.
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.student_2_response: From my point of view, young children shouldn't be exposed to online videos. First of all, watching online videos is not good for children's eyes. Since young children's eyes are still not fully developed and sensitive to long-term exposure to screens, the use of electronic devices will increase the risk of shortsightedness for young children, which will be clearly a significant drawback for their future life. Although some may argue that young children should be allowed to watch educational videos, the truth is that children's eye will be harmed by the screen of electronic devices regardless of what video they watch. In addition, addition to electronic devices is another crucial problem. Nowadays lots of apps have the mechanism that could send you the video that you'd like to watch, and children are likely to become indulged in it since their self-discipline skills are still not fully developed.
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.folder_name: Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Children？
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

TV or books.professor_prompt: Today, we're taking a look at the lasting effect of traditional media in our current society. Despite the emergence of digital platforms, traditional media such as television and books continue to have significant influence, shaping perspectives and opinions. In your view, is TV more important, or do books have a bigger effect on people in today's world? Share your thoughts and explain why you think that way.
TV or books.student_1_response: Books play a major role in our modern world because they offer specialized and in-depth knowledge. TV may give us the basics or a broad overview, but books really dig deep into various subjects, offering a full understanding and expert insights. This lets readers see different viewpoints and helps them think more critically. As a result, they can form well-rounded opinions based on comprehensive information.
TV or books.student_2_response: From my perspective, TV has a greater impact on people's live in today's world. To begin with, more people prefer watching TV. Nowadays, with the development of Internet, almost everyone has a television in his or her home. During the free time, all people would choose watching TV as their best way of finding relaxation because it contains variety of recreational channels like argument channel, cartoon channel, shopping channel and so on. Through browsing through the TV, people sooth their pressure. On the contrary, reading books tend to further take people's energy because it's impossible to read without thinking, making it less appeal when it comes to free time. Besides, TV could benefit people's real life. Many of the TV channels contain advertisements, which are likely to encounter people's need. For example, my uncle has found his job when he noticed the employment advertisement on TV. However, books could not provide such realistic aid, but instead, they tend to be merely a form of escaping from the reality by indulging into a fictional world.
TV or books.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.topic: Raising Fuel Costs to Reduce Air Pollution
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.professor_prompt: Your professor is teaching a class on economics. Write a post responding to the professor's question. In your response, you should do the following: Express and support your opinion. Make a contribution to the discussion in your own words. An effective response will contain at least 100 words. Dr. Achebe Today, we will examine what economists call incentives—the motivations that lead people to make certain choices. Cost is a major category of economic incentives. People tend to change their behavior when a particular choice gets more expensive. Let's discuss an example. Some economists argue that a good way to reduce air pollution is for governments to raise the cost (through taxes or other means) of fuel for cars. Do you agree or disagree with this viewpoint?
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.student_1_response: I think it would be a good idea to raise fuel prices. Making it more expensive to drive cars would cause many people to choose public transportation or use bicycles instead. In my city, they've just added bicycle lanes to all of the major roads. So, it would be easy to give up driving.
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.student_2_response: I disagree. Why should individuals be punished with such an added expense in their daily lives? The argument for a consumer fuel tax makes the assumption that cars are the biggest source of air pollution, and we need to question if that's an accurate assumption.
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.folder_name: Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Effects of Society Progress Happening To.topic: Speed of Scientific and Technological Progress
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.professor_prompt: In the past, progress in science and technology was generally slow. However, in recent decades, the pace of scientific and technological progress has increased dramatically, with new discoveries and inventions being developed almost every day. Some people think that this rapid progress in science and technology is beneficial for society overall and should be encouraged. Others believe this progress is happening too quickly and could create serious problems. Which view do you agree with, and why?
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.student_1_response: The faster discoveries are made, the better. Thanks to advances in medicine, for example, our lives are so much better than those of our great-great-grandparents. Back then, life expectancy was much shorter because of a lack of medicines that today are inexpensive and widely available. Anyone with a serious medical condition hopes for rapid scientific progress.
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that this progress is happening too fast and could have serious concerns. First, because these new technologies are not well developed yet, many negative impacts that people haven't thought about could exist. Our development of technology happened just a few hundred years ago, and it is still developing in a very fast speed. These will raise many concerns such as environmental issues, things could damage human health such as radiation and many more. Just like what happened during the Industrial Revolution, when people couldn't foresee the impact of greenhouse gases. Therefore, these underdeveloped and new technologies would cause more damage to people in the future if these rate isn't going to slow down. Furthermore, conflicts caused by technology are increasing, too. Due to the production of more variety of products, more and more resources are needed, which further forces the countries to fight over a certain raw material. For example, the conflict element, which are rare elements that are located in less developed countries causes forced labor, war, and serious human rights issues.
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.folder_name: Effects of Society Progress Happening Too Quickly
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Living in One Town or City All Your Life.topic: Living in One Town or City All Your Life
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.professor_prompt: Today, I'd like to discuss choices people make in terms of where they decide to live. Some people choose to spend their entire lives in one town or city. Others leave their hometowns and might even move several times from one town or city to another. I'd like to get your thoughts on this subject. Do you think it is better to live in one town or city all your life? Why or why not?
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.student_1_response: Living in one place your whole life is the better option. It allows you to form strong bonds with neighbors and members of your community. You know that if you stay in one place for a long time, you will always have friends you can rely on when you need help. Moving from one city to another has some advantages. Adapting to different situations is an important skill to have in life, and moving forces a person to develop this skill. Having to make new friends and start over in a new city is a challenging exercise that builds character.
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe living in various cities in my life would be a better idea than just dwelling in one place for our eternity. To begin with, constantly moving in other regions would bring us benefits in large scales. For instance, moving to new towns render the possibility of gaining the chance to become familiar with local residents. Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.professor_prompt: This week's course materials will focus on scientific discoveries. While scientific researchers usually prefer to share what they learn with other scientists, many businesses and governments keep certain scientific discoveries secret. Some people believe that all scientific discoveries should be shared freely among scientists all around the world and that governments and businesses should not keep any discoveries secret. What do you believe and why?
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.student_1_response: I don't think all discoveries should be shared. Sharing knowledge is crucially important to most scientists. Scientists usually publish the details of their discoveries in scientific journals, which means that everyone can see what the scientists have accomplished. Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that governments and businesses all over the world should share their scientific discoveries with each other. Therefore, all scientists could have more time focusing on more pressing subjects and topics. Second, such behavior would also encourage more people to participate in the scientific world, since a lot of data and key information are easily available in the shared community.

Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.topic: Teaching Methods: Lecturing vs. Interactive Learning
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.professor_prompt: One traditional method of classroom instruction is lecturing. Lecturing involves the teacher talking about a topic for an extended period of time and expecting students to learn by listening attentively. Today, some educators believe that teachers should limit how much time they spend lecturing and instead teach by encouraging in-class discussions and having students work in groups. However, some teachers still teach primarily by lecturing. Do you believe lecturing is an effective teaching method? Why or why not?
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.student_1_response: I think lecturing can be effective. Some teachers can explain even complex concepts by telling interesting stories and by providing memorable examples. When teachers lecture in an entertaining way, students enjoy attending class and feel motivated to learn. Whether a teacher's lectures are effective depends on the teacher.
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.student_2_response: In my opinion, lecturing is mainly ineffective because a teacher who only gives lectures can't know what's going on in students' minds. When a teacher lectures and students are just required to sit there, the teacher can't really check if students understand the lecture. Students have to contribute somehow to show whether or not they are learning. Active participation through discussions and group work allows teachers to identify misconceptions immediately and adjust their instruction accordingly. Relying solely on lectures creates a passive learning environment where students may become disengaged and retain less information.
